perturbation.original_text: Distributor is responsible for complying with all applicable laws, rules and regulations relating to its collection and use of personal information from users of the Distributor Portal. At a minimum, Distributor must adopt, implement and comply with a Privacy Policy that: (a) is easy to find, read and understand; (b) is prominently posted at the time that any personally identifiable information is collected or requested; and (c) clearly states what information is being collected, what the information will be used for, whether such information will be provided to third parties, and the choices available regarding collection, use and distribution of the collected information.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will use reasonable efforts to implement a Privacy Policy. The Privacy Policy should (a) be easy to find, read and understand; (b) be posted when personally identifiable information is collected or requested; and (c) states what information is being collected and what the information will be used for.
perturbation.explanation: This weakens the requirements for consumer privacy. By changing 'is responsible for complying with all applicable laws, rules and regulations' to a weaker 'reasonable efforts,' it creates a loophole. Removing the requirement to state 'whether such information will be provided to third parties, and the choices available regarding collection, use and distribution of the collected information' significantly weakens consumer rights regarding their data. Many jurisdictions, including China where the service is offered, have strict privacy laws requiring explicit consent and transparency regarding data sharing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: China's Cybersecurity Law and Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL), various US state privacy laws (e.g., CCPA in California).

perturbation.original_text: Each individual who purchases a Subscription must complete the Registration Process, where such individual will be prompted to provide certain personally identifiable information including a valid major credit card (e.g. Visa, MasterCard, Discover, American Express) to receive the Programming. Support for additional payment methods and additional credit cards may be developed by Distributor, with IMNTV's prior written approval.
perturbation.changed_text: Each individual who purchases a Subscription will complete the Registration Process. Support for additional payment methods and additional credit cards may be developed by Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The deletion of the specific personal identifiable information needed such as credit card will allow the distributor not to collect this information or collect it without needing a registration process that can protect the client identity. Therefore, It allows the distributor to go against state and federal law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), state consumer protection laws

perturbation.original_text: Subscription fee in Territory is to be determined based on market research performed by Distributor with pricing to be agreed upon jointly and in writing Each quarter, Distributor will make royalty payments to IMNTV based on a Structure as follows: 55% of subscriber revenue for the subscription based services broadcasting IMNTV content only, net of telecom percentage provided in accordance with this Agreement. ("Programming Payments"), subject to the following: The parties acknowledge that some mobile carriers may bill end users for a full month in a single billing, and that others may bill for partial months or pro-rate the billing of Recurring Subscribers. For each full month of Fees received from a Recurring Subscriber, Distributor will pay IMNTV based on the Rate Structure (the "Full Month Payment"). To the extent that Distributor receives a partial month's Fee or pro-rated Fee from a Recurring Subscriber as a result of a carrier's billing practices, Distributor will pay IMNTV a proportionate or pro-rated portion of such Full Month Payment based on the amount received by Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Subscription fee in Territory is to be determined based on market research performed by Distributor. Distributor will make royalty payments to IMNTV based on a Structure as follows: a percentage of subscriber revenue for the subscription based services broadcasting IMNTV content only, net of telecom percentage provided in accordance with this Agreement. The parties acknowledge that some mobile carriers may bill end users for a full month in a single billing, and that others may bill for partial months or pro-rate the billing of Recurring Subscribers.
perturbation.explanation: The deletion of 'with pricing to be agreed upon jointly and in writing' gives the right to the distributor to change the pricing of service whenever they desire. The omission of  '55%' provides the right to the distributor to not pay the 55% in royalties. These changes can cause the consumer/subscriber of the service to pay more without their acknowledgement, violating consumer financial protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Financial Protection Act (CFPA), state consumer protection laws
